intro: Romulea cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica squill, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Hyacinthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant produces a bulbous stem that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It typically blooms in spring and is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
